This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=COSCH.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T13:21:27Z Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2015-03-10T13:21:20+00:00 2015-03-10T13:21:20+00:00 Fw: Fully-funded PhD on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdInnovative methods and tools for sustainable curation, access and reuse of Digital Heritage\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;64ea5c86.1503 Fully-funded PhD on ‘Innovative methods and tools for sustainable curation, access and reuse of Digital Heritage’<br><br>This interdisciplinary PhD project will explore innovative ways to digitally provide curation, access and reuse Europe’s cultural heritage resources within the context of cultural dialogue, tourism and cultural industries. The aim of the project is to evaluate methodologies and approaches leading to richer interpretations of European heritage and cultural identity in the digital arena, and to bring new perspectives to the creation of applications and services for digital cultural assets. [...] Lindsay MacDonald 2015-03-09T14:53:05+00:00 2015-03-09T14:53:05+00:00 Re: Multispectral Imaging https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;cd42f16d.1503 Thanks very much for this, Steffi.<br>I know Giovanni from when he was a post-doc at the BM.<br>Hopefully lots of COSCH WG1 people will attend this workshop.<br><br>See you in St Etienne,<br><br>Lindsay<br><br>> Dear colleagues,<br>><br>> SKR (Swiss conservators-restorers association) is organizing at SUPSI<br>> (in Lugano) a two-days course in multispectral photography. The<br>> course is given by Dr. Giovanni Verri (Researcher and Lecturer at the<br>> Courtauld Institute of Art, University of London) and introduces the<br>> newly developed system for technical photography using flashes as<br>> illuminators (recent publication about<br>> thishttps://www.academia.edu/9469495/Xenon_flash_for_reflectance_and_luminescence_multispectral_imaging_in_cultural_heritage_applications<br>> )<br> [...] Stefanie Wefers 2015-03-09T10:24:50+01:00 2015-03-09T10:24:50+01:00 Multispectral Imaging https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;cb1ec297.1503 Dear colleagues,<br><br>SKR (Swiss conservators-restorers association) is organizing at SUPSI (in Lugano) a two-days course in multispectral photography. The course is given by Dr. Giovanni Verri (Researcher and Lecturer at the Courtauld Institute of Art, University of London) and introduces the newly developed system for technical photography using flashes as illuminators (recent publication about thishttps://www.academia.edu/9469495/Xenon_flash_for_reflectance_and_luminescence_multispectral_imaging_in_cultural_heritage_applications )<br>The course is given in Italian on 13-14 April and repeated in English on 16-17 April.<br>Please find attached the flyers with description of the course. Feel free to pass this info along to other potential participants.<br>Best regards<br>Steffi Wefers Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2015-02-28T13:42:41+00:00 2015-02-28T13:42:41+00:00 Colour and Space in Cultural Heritage | Publication opportunities https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;b5e6a609.1502 Contributions are invited for immediate and future peer-reviewed publication by Colour and Space in Cultural Heritage, www.cosch.info<br><br>COSCH is an interdisciplinary European network of experts in and users of the latest optical measuring techniques and imaging used in recording, examination and visualisation of artefacts. COSCH aims to enhance the existing practice and standards in 3D documentation, by promoting a better understanding of science, widening access and use of specialist technologies. [...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2015-02-13T17:05:55+00:00 2015-02-13T17:05:55+00:00 Fw: PhD studentship at the Cultural Informatics Research Group at the University of Brighton https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;f8f8fa1b.1502 From: Corinna Hattersley-Mitchell <C.Hattersley-Mitchell@BRIGHTON.AC.UK> Sent: 13 February 2015 16:22 Subject: [MCG] PhD studentship at the Cultural Informatics Research Group at the University of Brighton *Apologies for any cross posting* PhD studentship at the Cultural Informatics Research Group at the University of Brighton Title: Methods and tools for integrating and exploiting 3D and historic documentation in heterogeneous Digital Humanities repositories This research will develop techniques to combine 3D shape and surface colour data with relevant historic documentation. This combination will allow a wealth of previous research and content to be used in investigating the provenance of newly documented artefacts and advance [...] Milica Maric Stojanovic 2015-01-14T14:57:36+01:00 2015-01-14T14:57:36+01:00 Re: V-Must:net survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;6f8e6ca.1501 ><br>Draga Selma, zelim Vam Srecnu Novu Godinu i puno zdravlja i uspeha tokom<br>iste.<br><br>Trenutno sam u prepisci sa Magdalenom i zapoceli smo ispitivanja na nasoj<br>ikoni. Pitanje za Vas bi bilo da li bi za pocetak mogli da se dogovorimo<br>da Vi sastavite nase IR snimke koje budemo napravili na segmentima ikone<br>tako da se dobije cela ikona. Sada nisam mnogo vodila racuna o<br>udaljenosti, uvecanju i slicno jer nameravam da uradim bolje snimke kada<br>nas fotograf do&#273;e sa odmora. U svakom slucaju mogu da Vam posaljem to<br>sto imam da pogledate otprilike o cemu je rec. [...] Selma Rizvi\ufffd\ufffd 2015-01-13T13:44:47+01:00 2015-01-13T13:44:47+01:00 V-Must:net survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;8f3d563b.1501 Dear COSCH colleagues,<br><br>I would kindly ask you to fill out this short survey we need for finalization<br>of the V-Must.net project<br>https://docs.google.com/forms/d/114MX8brQrmdvy0Tge3w6WfzVDErO9bf2a14JfjEb1Mc/viewform?edit_requested=true#<br><br>Thanks in advance and best regards<br>Selma Stefanie Wefers 2015-01-08T17:16:53+01:00 2015-01-08T17:16:53+01:00 COSCH Call for STSMs https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;24a4e743.1501 Dear colleagues,<br>attached you find the<br>*5th Call for STSMs 2015 *of the<br>COST Action TD1201 "Colour & Space in Cultural Heritage (COSCH)".<br>Please feel free to forward this call to your colleagues or contacts who<br>might be interested in STSMs.<br>For more information see www.cosch.info<br>Yours sincerely,<br>Stefanie Wefers Clifford Leslie Ogleby 2014-11-25T02:44:32+00:00 2014-11-25T02:44:32+00:00 Re: Colourlab Workshop #6/2014: Cultural heritage image analysis and interpretation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;ee371d5c.1411 Bad timing, thanks for the invitation but I can't attend. Well done on assembling such an<br>excellent group of speakers!<br><br>I finally completed and submitted my PhD thesis, with the viva<br>scheduled for January. So now I have more time to consider other<br>projects, including EU opportunities. Please consider UCL if<br>you are forming a consortium. [...] Jon Yngve Hardeberg 2014-11-22T14:22:26+01:00 2014-11-22T14:22:26+01:00 Colourlab Workshop #6/2014: Cultural heritage image analysis and interpretation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;ed176391.1411 Dear COSCH community,<br><br>The Norwegian Colour and Visual Computing Laboratory<br>(www.colourlab.no) is pleased to announce its sixth workshop of<br>the year, on the topic of "Cultural heritage image analysis and<br>interpretation". This workshop is quite unique in many ways. It goes<br>over two days and in two locations, at Gj\ufffd\ufffdvik University College on<br>Thursday December 4th and at the University of Oslo on Monday December<br>8th. We address the field from many angles and approaches; the historic<br>approach to interpret ancient texts, conservation and analysis of art<br>objects, the digitization needs of the archive and library sector,<br>research funding opportunities [...] Bentkowska-Kafel, Anna 2014-11-08T00:54:44+00:00 2014-11-08T00:54:44+00:00 COSCH Session at CAA 2015 Siena | Call for Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=COSCH;c036a0c0.1411 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>There will be a COSCH session at the CAA 2015 Conference in Siena, 30 March-3 April 2015, see http://caaconference.org/program/ [Session 6D]. We invite papers addressing key interdisciplinary questions - scientific and technological, theoretical and practical - concerning the development and use of optical measuring techniques and electronic imaging, applied to documentation and presentation of artefacts. The deadline for submitting abstracts is 20 November 2014. The submission is strictly through the conference website, at the URL given above.
